text: Sir Wilfred Ebenezer Jacobs (19 October 1919 â€“ 11 March 1995) was the first Governor-General of Antigua and Barbuda. He appointed Attorney General of the Leeward Islands for 1957 to 1959 and for Antigua in 1960. From 1960 to 1967 he was in a number of Colonial offices. He was made Governor of Antigua and Barbuda from 1967 until that country gained independence in 1981, after which he became the first governor-general. He was Governor-General of Antigua and Barbuda from 1 November 1981 to 10 June 1991. He was replaced by James Carlisle. ==References== Category:1919 births Category:1995 deaths Category:Governors-General of Antigua and Barbuda
title: Wilfred Jacobs
